CLOSE ON THE HOUND DOG -- lifting his big nose in the air, he sniffs mightily and then... BAYING LIKE HE'S COON HUNTING UNDER A KENTUCKY MOON, the Hound Dog leaps off his table, heads after Drew.

The TWO SHOW OFFICIALS,    sporting nifty sweaters and manicures, are prepared    to sacrifice their lives to bl the door. In addition     to the PARTICIPANTS trying to g inside, they're holding    off Roger, Mr. Lo Biancho, Williamson and Hogan.
(quite disturbed)
No entry without official credentials!
I'm Emile Lo Biancho! I demand to be let in!
NYPD!   Move aside! At the mention of POLICE, Roger's EYES GO WIDE. He slinks down, losing himself in the crowd and sidles off.
(chin set)
I'll have to see identification, officers. (to Mr. Lo Biancho)
I'm so sorry, Mr. Lo Biancho. Go right in. AT THE CORNER, Parker and Warren keep their distance, not wanting to be seen by the Detectives.
You think she made it?
She's faster than she looks.
She is -- but now she's not running to catch a policeman, but to try to keep from being over-taken by...

head_text.subj: ... A GIANT PACK OF PEDIGREED POOCHES WHO CHASE DREW

text: The ROAR of the CROWD and the BARKING of the PACK draw the attention of everyone in the Lo Bianchos' box. MORTY
Isn't that The Emperor, ma'am? MRS. LO BIANCHO
Good God.   He's mauve.
Drew makes it across the floor and out the other side into a tunnel...
... appearing in the concession area.
as it breaks off, jumps onto a concession stand and begins looting it. Drew makes for the EXIT past the TICKET TAKERS who leap out of the way and just as she reaches the door and pushes it open...

head_text.subj: THEY CATCH UP TO HER IN A SWARM, KNOCKING HER ONTO THE
SIDEWALK OUTSIDE WHERE SHE DISAPPEARS UNDERNEATH A

text: Williamson, Hogan, Morty, Bruce, Mr. and Mrs. Lo Biancho and quite a few SPECTATORS pour out the doors.

head_text.subj: STILL HUGGING THE EMPEROR IN THE MIDDLE OF THE PACK, ALL
OF WHOM GLEEFULLY LICK HER FACE

text: Please!  I'll get hives! (resigned)
Oh, go ahead.
The Detectives appear above her.
She holds up The Emperor.
I, uh, just wanted to return him. As the other OWNERS and HANDLERS gather their dogs, Williamson hands The Emperor off to Mrs. Lo Biancho while Hogan handcuffs Drew.
Flog her! Step aside and I'll whip her myself!
(dead calm)
Didn't you say it was a man who called, Dear?
So she had an accomplice! We'll beat the information out of the little wench! (handing him The Emperor)
Get him cleaned up, Emile. Williamson and Hogan move Drew toward their car.
I didn't take her dog, I swear.
We'll sort it out.
But I have this interview. I mean, it's not really an interview. I'd never lie to the police... (it's over)

... never mind. Just as they push her head down into the car, she glimpses a vaguely familiar face among the myriad GAWKERS -- it's the Bike Messenger. For just an instant they lock eyes before the car pulls away.
Parker and Warren round the corner at a run, only in time to watch the Detective's car leave with Drew in the back window.
What now?
We have to go to the jail and tell them what happened.
What on earth did happen?
Poor Drew. She wanted to get into that program more than anything in the world. With a SIGH, they turn to go and BUMP -- knock into Bennie, who's staring coldly down at Parker.
You goin' somewhere? She's paralyzed with fear.
(gulp)
Hello, sir.
Oh my God!   Please don't kill me!
Kill?
We don't know anything at all! We didn't see anything or hear anything and I'll swear to that in a court of law! Bennie appears unmoved. Parker closes her eyes, trying to meet death with dignity.
Just not in the face.
What's the big idea? You two a couple a nutbags or somethin'? She opens one eye.

Nut bags? No. I mean,    yes. Is there a right answer to  that? See, my sister had this  interview which turned out not to  be an interview, really and I  sort of messed things up because  I wanted to meet him. Indicating Warren.
Really?   You came into town just for me?   Wow.
Not now, Warren. (back to Bennie)
Drew was going to be late even though technically she wasn't going to be late since there wasn't an interview and that's when we got in your car. I promise we meant to pay. It was a true emergency.
I meant, why you runnin' when I'm trying to give you your bag back? Bennie hands Parker Drew's daybag.      Parker takes it, still trying to comprehend.
You were just...?

I found your mom's number in the book. She said you needed it pretty badly for that big interview. Listen, I gotta go. It's my mother-in-law's birthday and I gotta plant some stupid rose bush and then take her out to dinner at the Pier. See ya around. Bennie waddles over to his Town Car and climbs in.
(beat; calling after)
Thank you?
Well, he certainly is a good Samaritan. Parker looks at the daybag.
You guys lead a pretty interesting life, don't you? But now Parker's mind is elsewhere.     She pulls out Dre daybook, opens it.
We going to the jail, or what? I've never been to a jail before.
What time is it?
FLASH! A MUGS HOT is taken of Drew, looking as bedraggled, beaten and defeated as humanly possible.
